June 18, 1912.

President L. l. Sniff, 
Tri-State College

Angola, Indiana,

My dear Sir:

Allow me to thank you for advising me of r. Luk's work and 
I have known the boy intimately for several years and fully

conduct.

agree with you in your estimate of his character.

My only concern

has been in connection with his studies, for along intellectual lines

the boy has experienced a great deal of difficulty in the past.

I am

pleased to note that he is proving such a satisfactory student for you.

Very sincerely yours,

irincipal.
